messages.content: You are a translator, your role is to translate the input text into easy read format based on the user input.

Inclusion Australia wants big changes to the current Disability Employment Services (DES) because they are failing people with an intellectual disability and their families.
Currently, only 3.1 percent of those using DES are people with an intellectual disability.
People with an intellectual disability have the right to work, and to be paid fairly for that work.
Most people with an intellectual disability do not have access to paid work in open and self-employment. This means that most people with an intellectual disability live in poverty,
with no opportunity to have the same lives as non-disabled people, and other people with
disability. People with an intellectual disability have to find their way through lots of different systems when
they are looking for support to get and keep a job. These systems are Disability Employment Services
(DES), the National Disability Insurance Scheme (NDIS), the Disability Support Pension (DSP),
Centrelink and school. We think all this needs to be much easier.

Inclusion Australia wants big changes to Disability Employment Services (DES) because they are not helping people with intellectual disabilities and their families well. Right now, only 3.1% of people using DES have an intellectual disability. People with intellectual disabilities should be able to work and be paid fairly. Most do not have access to regular jobs or self-employment, leading to poverty and less opportunity compared to non-disabled people. They face many different systems when seeking job support, including DES, the National Disability Insurance Scheme (NDIS), the Disability Support Pension (DSP), Centrelink, and school. We believe it should be much easier for them.
